intro: Agerella arvensis, commonly known as the field agrimony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rosaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a serrated margin and produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a dry, schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Agerella arvensis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
